Posts.Content: So do people think this is typical NHS? Or could it be because my results aren’t bad so they don’t mind taking their time about it?! Xx
Posts.Title: Advice needed please!!

Posts.Content: Thanks all.  I rang the hospital up and they said the earliest time they can get me in to discuss my results is Feb the 2nd!! It’s going to be a horrible few days  xx
Posts.Title: Advice needed please!!

Posts.Content: Hi guys me again!! (Sorry)  So I received a letter this morning from my breast ultrasound which was sent to my GP and CC’d to myself.  The radiologist who took a biopsy of my lump has described it as a “indeterminate” lump. I’ve been trying to do some research in regards to this term and I had found that this seems to mean that my lump shows no malignant signs but no benign ones either... which may explain that when I asked for his honest opinion he said to me “it doesn’t look benign, but it doesn’t look like grade 3 cancer either”  Anyway basically I am just wandering if anyone had a “indeterminate lump” and what it turned out to be?? I’m even more confused now and I don’t find out my results until a week Friday!! (February 2nd) I’m driving myself insane. I need to know, I can handle it. I can’t handle the unknown. Thanks guys and sorry again xx
Posts.Title: Advice needed please!!

Posts.Content: Hiya. I have posted before but basically I found a lump in my breast a couple of weeks ago. I had an ultrasound and breast biopsy on Tuesday last week. The radiologist said “it doesn’t look benign, but it doesn’t look like grade 3 cancer either” when I asked for his honest opinion. So I’ve been worried ever since. I’ve had a phone call today to say that my follow op appointment with my results will be on Friday 2nd Feb which is over a week away! I was told I should know by the end of this week. Obviously all this waiting around is really stressing me out. I called the hospital back up and asked if my appointment could be bought forward but they told me it couldn’t As that was the only next available appointment with my doctor at the breast clinic as he is the only doctor there. So my question is does this mean it could be good news because they’re leaving me so long? Regardless of what the radiologist said to me at my scan? Or has anyone else with a positive diagnosis had to wait so long from biopsy until their results? Please advice me!!! My head is going to explode! Thanks in advance xx
Posts.Title: Advice needed please!!

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for your replies.  I will be sure to update you all next week Xx
Posts.Title: Indeterminate lump

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn thanks for your reply.  Ahh yes I have experienced similar with the nurses over the phone not being able to tell you results it’s a nightmare! My lump is 22mm according to the letter.  Everything is just so confusing at this stage. I really appreciate the reply and your help. Thank you so much and best wishes xx

Posts.Title: Indeterminate lump

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply Helen.  That is another thing which is driving me mad. I’m thinking because they have made me wait 12 days to come in to get my results I’m thinking “it could be a positive sign as it is urgent” and then on the other foot I’m thinking “they’re taking their time because they need to discuss treatment going forward” I’m really stressing myself out about all this. The indeterminate phrase has baffled me! Does anyone have an experience with this word themselves?  Xx
Posts.Title: Indeterminate lump
